title.value: Pluvio: Assembly Clone Search for Out-of-domain Architectures and Libraries through Transfer Learning and Conditional Variational Information Bottleneck
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as mentioned in the provided text.
title.quote: Pluvio: Assembly Clone Search for Out-of-domain Architectures and Libraries through Transfer Learning and Conditional Variational Information Bottleneck

extractions.description: This paper introduces Pluvio, a robust assembly code clone search engine designed to address the challenges posed by unseen architectures and libraries during training, by integrating human common knowledge through large-scale pre-trained natural language models, a reinforcement learning agent, and a novel Conditional Variational Information Bottleneck (CVIB) learning strategy.

type.justification: The paper conducts experiments to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed model, Pluvio, against state-of-the-art solutions, indicating that it is an empirical study.
type.quote: We simulate the unseen architecture clone search scenarios and the experimental results show the effectiveness of the proposed approach against the state-of-the-art solutions.

name.justification: The paper leverages large-scale pre-trained natural language models and NLP techniques for assembly code clone search.
name.quote: We propose incorporating human common knowledge through large-scale pre-trained natural language models, in the form of transfer learning, into current learning-based approaches for assembly clone search.

name.justification: The paper utilizes transfer learning by incorporating knowledge from pre-trained natural language models to address the limitations of existing approaches in assembly clone search.
name.quote: We propose incorporating human common knowledge through large-scale pre-trained natural language models, in the form of transfer learning, into current learning-based approaches for assembly clone search.

name.justification: The paper proposes a reinforcement learning agent to improve the model's performance by removing unnecessary and redundant tokens.
name.quote: We propose a reinforcement learning agent to remove unnecessary and redundant tokens.

name.justification: The paper introduces a novel Conditional Variational Information Bottleneck (CVIB) learning strategy to enhance the modelâ€™s resilience to out-of-domain architectures and libraries.
name.quote: We propose modifying the Variational Information Bottle (VIB) [4, 46] learning method to compress the information learned about the code architecture and optimization settings.

name.justification: Pluvio is the primary model introduced in the paper for assembly code clone search.
name.quote: Our proposed model, named Pluvio, has the following components: a pretrained natural language model based on MPNet [44], a tokenizer, denoted by MPNetTokenizer, and an encoder denoted by MPNetEmbedder.

is_contributed.justification: The model was introduced and evaluated within the scope of the paper, indicating it is a contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: Our proposed model, named Pluvio, has the following components: a pretrained natural language model based on MPNet [44], a tokenizer, denoted by MPNetTokenizer, and an encoder denoted by MPNetEmbedder.

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses the implementation and execution of Pluvio as part of the study.
is_executed.quote: The input for training Pluvio is a pair of assembly instruction sequences... The output sscore is the similarity score of the pair.

is_compared.justification: The experimental results include comparisons of Pluvio against various state-of-the-art methods.
is_compared.quote: The convincing results demonstrate that Pluvio is a robust and effective assembly code clone search engine which accurately classifies assembly codes in unseen architectures or from unseen libraries.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no indication that Pluvio is referenced from another paper; it is introduced in this paper.

name.justification: OOD-ARCH is one of the datasets used for out-of-domain architecture tests in the experiments.
name.quote: For the out-of-domain architecture test (OOD-ARCH), using assembly functions from the same libraries and architectures of PowerPC and MIPS.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This dataset was created and used within the scope of the paper for experimental evaluation.
referenced_paper_title.quote: For the out-of-domain architecture test (OOD-ARCH), using assembly functions from the same libraries and architectures of PowerPC and MIPS.

name.justification: OOD-LIBS is one of the datasets used for out-of-domain libraries tests in the experiments.
name.quote: Using assembly functions from different libraries (Putty, CoreUtils, Curl, and Magick) for the out-of-domain libraries test (OOD-LIB).

referenced_paper_title.justification: This dataset was created and used within the scope of the paper for experimental evaluation.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Using assembly functions from different libraries (Putty, CoreUtils, Curl, and Magick) for the out-of-domain libraries test (OOD-LIB).

name.justification: OOD-ARCH&LIBS is one of the datasets used for out-of-domain architecture and libraries tests in the experiments.
name.quote: Using assembly functions from different libraries (Putty, CoreUtils, etc.) and from different architectures (MIPS and PowerPC) for the out-of-domain architecture and libraries test (OOD-ARCH&LIB).

referenced_paper_title.justification: This dataset was created and used within the scope of the paper for experimental evaluation.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Using assembly functions from different libraries (Putty, CoreUtils, etc.) and from different architectures (MIPS and PowerPC) for the out-of-domain architecture and libraries test (OOD-ARCH&LIB).

name.justification: The training dataset used consisted of assembly functions derived from certain libraries and architectures as described.
name.quote: When building our training dataset, we select assembly functions derived from libraries (BusyBox, OpenSSL, and splite3) and ARM, AMD64, and x86 as three assembly architectures.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This dataset was created and used within the scope of the paper for training purposes.
referenced_paper_title.quote: When building our training dataset, we select assembly functions derived from libraries (BusyBox, OpenSSL, and splite3) and ARM, AMD64, and x86 as three assembly architectures.

name.justification: MPNet is used as a pretrained natural language model for creating embeddings of assembly functions.
name.quote: Our proposed model, named Pluvio, has the following components: a pretrained natural language model based on MPNet [44], a tokenizer, denoted by MPNetTokenizer, and an encoder denoted by MPNetEmbedder.

referenced_paper_title.value: MPNet: Masked and Permuted Pre-training for Language Understanding
referenced_paper_title.justification: The MPNet model is referenced from another paper as indicated.
